meanings.definition: The furthest point or limit of something.
meanings.sent1: She reached the extremities of her patience while waiting in line.
meanings.sent2: The extremities of the desert seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent3: The extremities of the internet can be a strange and wonderful place.
meanings.sent4: His love knew no extremities, reaching even the darkest corners of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The extremities of his fear gripped him tightly, paralyzing his every move.

meanings.definition: The hands and feet of a person.
meanings.sent1: She wrapped her extremities in warm gloves and socks before heading out into the snow.
meanings.sent2: His extremities were numb from the cold winter air.
meanings.sent3: The extremities of a dancer are crucial for graceful movements on stage.
meanings.sent4: Her extremities danced across the piano keys with skill and precision.
meanings.sent5: The extremities of a rock climber must be strong and agile to conquer challenging routes.
